It is interesting to note that JavaScript classes, introduced in ES6, are primarily syntactical sugar over JavaScript’s existing prototype-based inheritance. The class syntax does not introduce a new object-oriented inheritance model to JavaScript. #WebDev @NortheasternCA

It's been nearly 33 years since the dawn of the Web as we know of it. There have been several changes moving from Web 1.0, a static, centralized, read-only version to Web 3.0 version that aims to be dynamic, decentralized that uses machine learning and AI #WebDev @NortheasternCA

Diff algo runtime could be O(n^3) which is bad news for render. What did React diff do to reduce the runtime?
1.Tree diff: only compare DOM nodes at the same level. 2. Component diff: if they are different types, delete and replace with new ones.
#WebDev @NortheasternCA

React fiber: In React V15, drop frame happens :( React V16 changed the stack reconciler to fiber reconciler, which is a singly-linked list with fiber nodes, to record prev and next steps. The traverse therefore can be stopped and restarted. #webdev @NortheasternCA

week 5 - Server side rendering: when user request for the first time, server side will render the components/pages into HTML strings and return to client side. Client side then saved the trouble of generating DOM and run JS codes.
#webdev @NortheasternCA

week 4 - why doesn't HTML form submit cause CORS error? Submit form will redirect to a new domain, the original page can't retrieve the updated content, which is different from ajax request. #webdev @NortheasternCA

week 3 - About Node.js multithreading. When facing CPU-intensive tasks, Node.js uses child_process to "clone threads" and creates the master-worker mode. 
#WebDev @NortheasternCA

Week 2 - how did closure happen? When accessing a variable, a parser would: Step 1. Look for the variable at its current local scope, if no -> Look for the variable at the "parent" scope, if not -> Repeatedly looking for it until its found or not found. #WebDev @NortheasternCA
@duto_guerra reply

【week 1 reading】Why do we need TCP 3-way handshake and what are the handshakes about - to transmit data in a safe way. Handshake 1: Hi, this is client side. Handshake 2: Hi client side, received, this is server side. Handshake 3: Let's connect then.

#WebDev @NortheasternCA

With experience in Vue.js and React.js, I can see some major differences between them. React uses JSX and single-file component structure, whereas Vue uses HTML template to organize the files. There's no right way to do it but personally I prefer React.  
#WebDev @NortheasternCA

Repainting is triggered each time real DOM is updated, and it becomes slow when there're too many nodes. React keeps a virtual DOM and updates it first, and chooses the right time to update real DOM. This reduces repainting and gains better performance.
#WebDev @NortheasternCA

When working with forms, it's the best practice that the for attribute of a label takes the value of the id attribute which it is associated with. This helps with usability and accessibility, for example people can click on the label to activate the input. #WebDev @NortheasternCA

Choosing between SQL databases and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB is hard—but you can use them both at the same time. Just make sure use the right one for the right job. For example, storing transactional records in SQL and schema-less records in NoSQL. #WebDev @NortheasternCA

Now installing Node.js comes with npm and npx. As a package manager, npm is used to install packages and modules. While npx executes a package without installing it. A useful example is to run `npx create-react-app my-app` to create a learner React env.

#WebDev @NortheasternCA

JavaScript makes frontend pages interactive. But developers want it also to be powerful outside of a browser, so Node.js was born. Then JS can be used as a backend language in the server-side. Based on Node.js, we have Express as the backend framework.  #WebDev @NortheasternCA

With knowledge in XML, HTML looks very familiar. Both markup languages take the form of opening and closing tags. However, you can define new tags in XML and only use predefined tags in HTML. XML is for transporting data while HTML is for displaying them.

#WebDev @NortheasternCA
